name: GitSubmoduleUpdater
description: Check git submodules and determine which ones need updating to latest commits
helpMarkDown: This task checks all git submodules in the repository and compares their current commit with the latest commit on the main branch of each submodule repository. [More Information](https://github.com/TimothyK/GitSubmoduleUpdater)
author: TimothyK

inputs.name: failOnOutdated
inputs.label: Fail if submodules are outdated
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the task will fail if any submodules are found to be outdated.

inputs.name: addPullRequestComments
inputs.label: Add Pull Request Comments
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, add comments to the pull request for each submodule that needs updating (only when running in a Pull Request build).

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory containing the .gitmodules file. Defaults to the repository root.

inputs.name: gitmodulesPath
inputs.label: .gitmodules File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the .gitmodules file relative to the working directory.

inputs.name: defaultBranch
inputs.label: Default Branch Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The default branch name to check for latest commits on submodule repos (e.g., 'main', 'master', 'develop').

outputVariables.name: SubmodulesUpToDate
outputVariables.description: Number of submodules that are up to date

outputVariables.name: SubmodulesNeedingUpdate
outputVariables.description: Number of submodules that need updating

outputVariables.name: SubmodulesNeedingUpdateList
outputVariables.description: Comma-separated list of submodule paths that need updating
